chargeHist.descr: Stalking - Prev Conviction ... Domestic Abuse offense

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan D VanBrocklin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Stalking - Prev Conviction of Domestic Abuse, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Probation may be transferred to Racine.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided)  and pay surcharge.  Cash bond posted shall be applied.
Contact with wife will be only as allowed by agent.  DOC shall promptly notify the Court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Patrick Cafferty.  Victim present.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for one year.  See conditions.  Probation may be transferred to Racine.  Appeal rights.  Firearm warning.  Voting acknowledgment.  DNA ordered; notice given to deft.  Bond to be applied towards any financial obligations.  Balance to be returned to poster.  NOTE - this conviction is for Stalking - Previous conviction of domestic abuse.  Until the CCAP record is corrected - the judgment shall not be entered.
from victim

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  Special Pros K R Wells appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Patrick Cafferty.  Victim rights compliance.  Deft pleads guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Parties waive PSI.  Victim present; statement made.  After conclusion of victim's statement, Court decides to order a PSI.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 9/10/15 @ 2:30pm
Final pre-trial on July 24, 2015 at 11:15 am.
